title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
McKinsey's partners voted to remove Kevin Sneader as the consulting firm's leader after internal dissatisfaction over steps he took following a series of crises for the company.

---

The Dow rose 1.3% to a record, while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq gained 1.1% and 1%, respectively. The Russell 2000 jumped 2.4%.

---

Customers in Texas' deregulated electricity market have paid $28 billion more for electricity over two decades than they would have at the rates charged to residents served by traditional utilities.

---

WeWork co-founder and ex-CEO Neumann is set to reap an extra $50 million windfall and other benefits as part of an agreement that would settle a dispute with SoftBank.

---

Fed Chairman Powell, in House testimony, underscored his determination to return the U.S. labor market to full strength.

---

Verizon secured more than half of the wireless airwaves offered in a government auction that racked up a record $81 billion in bids.

---

Foxconn agreed to assemble cars for electric-vehicle startup Fisker, expanding further into the auto sector.

---

Hong Kong moved unexpectedly to raise taxes on share trading by 30%, as the city's stock-exchange operator unveiled record sales and profits.

---

Australian legislation effectively requiring Facebook and Google to pay news outlets for content cleared its last big parliamentary hurdle.
